thread.title: Thirsty Merc to resume tour after fatal accident
thread.title_full: Thirsty Merc to resume tour after fatal accident

author: Sarah Thomas
title: Thirsty Merc to resume tour after fatal accident
text:
Thirsty Merc's Phil Stack, Rai Thistlethwayte and Matt Smith 
Drummer Mick Skelton wakes from coma Stage manager killed in crash Thirsty Merc has announced their nationwide tour will resume next week following the accident which killed stage manager Shane Cooper and put touring drummer Mick Skelton in intensive care. 
The band has paid tribute to Cooper and thanked fans for the support after the accident in Streatham in Western Victoria on September 22.
"There were moments where we seriously questioned whether we'd be walking out on stage at all for the rest of the year," the band said in a statement. "We'll always be thinking of Shane. We find some comfort in knowing that he had so many happy moments in his last days with us. Our thoughts are also with Mick every day as he continues to make a recovery — we're sending him all the strength we can muster up."
Advertisement The remaining 25 dates of the tour will kick off on Wednesday, October before continuing across NSW, Queensland, Victoria and Western Australia. 
A spokeswoman for the band said no decision had been made yet on a replacement for Skelton and it could be possible that the band perform as a three-piece only as mark of support for Skelton. 
The band said the messages from well-wishers has been overwhelming. "We've been shown a lot of love through that support, and it really has helped us as a band in getting through a truly devastating time."
A percentage of proceeds from the tickets for The Good Life t our, named after the single from the band's new album Shifting Gears, will go towards the families of Cooper and Skelton. A benefit concert is also being planned. 
The original 39-date tour began on September 14, with eight dates missed due to the accident.
Skelton woke from his coma earlier this week and is now out of intensive care, according to Sarah McLeod, the Superjesus frontwoman and friend of the band who has been posting updates on Facebook. 
McLeod had also posted that the funeral of Shane Cooper happened on Thursday. "Hard day, good man. He will be missed. RIP Shane X".
For full tour information, see thirstymerc.com. 
 
Sending love for Shane Coopers family . Today is his funeral. Hard day, good man. He will be missed. R.I.P Shane X
— Sarah McLeod (@SarahMcLeod1) September 30, 2015
